result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin J Roskopf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence defendant is serving
Conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall notify all healthcare providers of addiction history.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not associate with known drug dealers or users.

Defendant shall not be present in any place where controlled substances are illegally purchased, sold or consumed.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall submit to random blood, breath or urine drug screens.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin J Roskopf

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  Resolution reached; defense free to argue on condition time.  State moves to dismiss the subsequent offender enhancer on Ct. 1; Defendant to enter a plea to charge in Ct. 1.  In addition, State moves to dismiss and read in Cts. 2 and 3. Court reluctantly strikes the subsequent offender enhancer on Ct. 1.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 as amended and orders Cts. 2 and 3 dismissed and read in.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  Arraignment continued; resolution anticipated.  Arraignment scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Defendant is serving a sanction until mid-January.  Arraignment scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with Washington County Walmart Store.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty. Alyssa Armbrust from the State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  $2,500 signature bond set.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
